Arnold and Willis are back for another season of one of televisions most memorable sitcoms!
During this 1981-82 Season, Arnold (Gary Coleman) lands in trouble with the law when he tries to join the Goochs private club, Willis (Todd Bridges) sues the basketball team when he is replaced by another player, Kimberly (Dana Plato) goes on a forbidden weekend skiing trip and Philip. Drummond (Conrad Bain) learns of a love child he had while serving in the Korean War!

One of the true classics from the golden era of TV sitcoms, DIFF'RENT STROKES focused heavily on family values, social issues and big laughs throughout it's whole 8-year run.

This 1981-1982 Season of DIFF'RENT STROKES takes me all the way back to memory lane to when I was 9 years old in the 3rd grade & was shown on NBC every Thursday night at 8PM before QUINCY, M.E. at 9PM and when we had all those budget cuts going on from the recession we had back in 1981-1982 when Ronald Reagan was president.

My Son is in love with this show aside that I told him that this was one of my favorite shows when I was his age.  He keeps on telling me that the shows now a days suck and that he loves watching 80's shows. I couldn't say it better myself.

This show was much better than I thought... So where is Season 5??? How am I supposed to get to season 6, where Michael knight of Knight Rider is in a two parter with k. I.T.T. at Universal Studios??? My favorite two episodes.  Here's the catch... I will not purchase season 5 until I see season 6 released.  I will live with the first four seasons.  Dana Plato was fired after season 6, and her death years later was very sad.  She was very pretty and had a future, if she tried harder.

The continuation of this great family sitcom is awesome. My 12 year old son is requesting all seasons by the end of the year. He is laughing as hard as I did when I saw it in the 80's. Arnold, Willis, Kimberly and Mr. Drummond will forever be part of our family.
One of my favorite shows growing up as a kid and now my kids love it.  Great price and the shipment came right on time!

I love, do you hear me, loved this show when I was growing up. Just watching this show on DVD definitely brings back some good childhood memories. Just wish the kids had better lives outside the show, but that's the magic of television, where you can just sit back and escape. I remember this was the show when I first developed a crush on Janet Jackson when she played Charlene DuPrey, Willis' longtime girlfriend. I also had a crush on Dana Plato. Being able to see her each week was my main reason for tuning in. I hope 'Shout! factory' continues to release the remaining seasons.
great tv shows on dvd diff'rent is the best show since the 70s and the 80s cool and great and

In "Diff'rent Strokes - The Complete Fourth Season", the original cast returns, including Dody Goodman returning as the charming & eccentric Aunt Sophia. The serious subject matter blends in quite well with the comedy in episodes such as "Health Club", where Willis & Arnold are denied entry into Mr. Drummond's exclusive club, & in the episode titled "Crime Story" - a two-parter with Arnold & Dudley being bullied by two schoolyard thugs in giving up their school lunches. Willis escorts girlfriend Charlene in Mr. D's limousine in "The Car" & Arnold fears for Mr. D's safety in the episode "Dreams". Willis acquires a service station job in "Lifesavers", & Drummond learns he has a son whom he never met in "Hello Daddy". This fourth season is worth watching, where the viewer can learn many a life lesson through successive viewings while picking up many a laugh all the while. After all, in spite of the serious subject matter contained herein, this is still a sitcom the entire family can view together. Make this season of "Diff'rent Strokes" a must-have on your priority shopping list ASAP!

R.I.P., Conrad Bain, Gary Coleman, Dana Plato, Nedra Volz & Dody Goodman.

The writing & directing went downhill after the second season.  If not for Gary Coleman, I'd rate it only two stars.  The subject matter & issues became serious, & that's not why viewers liked this show.

If you grew up watching this show, the DVD is a great way to get nostalgic.
Although the episodes are a little dated, it still holds up.
You cannot go wrong with Diff'rent Strokes. Classic comedy television at its best. I definitely recommend buying this and all the seasons available if you like this show.

So many great childhood memories with this show & although there has been mistakes made during the younger stars early adult years, to millions of viewers who viewed this show during its original run, it had such a positive impact as well as given us so many laughs, I was 4 Years old when I started watching this show & I leaned so many positive life lessons & messages on this show, it's time to finally respect the memories of the late cast & except we all made & make mistakes & give Todd Bridges the respect he deserves for changing his life the way he has & never forget the show itself is such a cool positive fun show, viewers as well as the cast should be so proud to watch this show & have worked on a type of show that brought so much laughter to millions of Families, RIP Conrad Bain, Dana Plato & Gary Coleman

February 11, 2013

Another great boxed set of "Diff'rent Strokes" episodes. I blew through the whole season in a weekend. Nice uncut episodes. I watched these in first-run as well as syndication. The episodes are all great, and it's nice to see Janet Jackson as Willis' girlfriend. My only gripe is Mr. Drummond's sister is in almost every episode, and she is very annoying. I don't remember seeing her in so many episodes before. All in all, a great set, and I highly recommend it.

My daughter, Melanie Watson was a co-star on the titled episode and it was her initial appearance on the show.  I would prefer to purchase that one episode only and wish Amazon offerred that in lieu of the whole season.  I am grateful however; for the CD I received.

Diff'rent Strokes is definately a nice show and I'm glad to be able to watch it on DVD but I still can't see any subtitles or bonus features such as bloopers or audio commentaries that's too bad coz I'm sure Gary had troubles delivering the "Watchooo talkin' bout Willis?" line sometimes not to mention Todd, Dana or Conrad LOL! Come on Shout Factory try to find juicy bonus features for season 5. A boxset with only episodes is not good enough for fans. That's why I rated the product 4 stars instead of 5.

A BIG THANKS GOES OUT TO SHOUT! FOR PICKING UP THE RIGHTS TO THIS GREAT SERIES. I LOVE THIS SHOW AND PRE ORDERED SEASON 3 WHEN IT BECAME AVAILABLE AND DID THE SAME FOR SEASON 4. KEEP EM COMING SHOUT! GREAT JOB.
